content:
XamlLoadPermission Class

In this Article

Declares permissions for loading types from assemblies that are used by a XAML reader or writer.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class XamlLoadPermission : System.Security.CodeAccessPermission, System.Security.Permissions.IUnrestrictedPermission

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Security.CodeAccessPermission
  • XamlLoadPermission

Inherited Members

Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
Assert()
,
Demand()
,
Deny()
,
Equals(Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
PermitOnly()
,
RevertAll()
,
RevertAssert()
,
RevertDeny()
,
RevertPermitOnly()
,
ToString()

Remarks

XamlLoadPermission is relevant for scenarios such as whether internal types are permitted to load under partial trust.

Constructors summary

XamlLoadPermission(IEnumerable<XamlAccessLevel>)

Initializes a new instance of the XamlLoadPermission class, using an enumerable set of specific XamlAccessLevel values.
XamlLoadPermission(PermissionState)

Initializes a new instance of the XamlLoadPermission class, using existing permissions.
XamlLoadPermission(XamlAccessLevel)

Initializes a new instance of the XamlLoadPermission class, using a single XamlAccessLevel value.

Properties summary

AllowedAccess

Gets the list of all XamlAccessLevel values that this XamlLoadPermission represents.

Methods summary

Copy()

Creates and returns an identical copy of the current XamlLoadPermission.
FromXml(SecurityElement)

Reconstructs a security object with a specified state from an XML encoding.
Includes(XamlAccessLevel)

Returns whether this XamlLoadPermission includes a specified XamlAccessLevel in its stem.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.AllowedAccess* list.
Intersect(IPermission)

Creates and returns a XamlLoadPermission that is the intersection of the current XamlLoadPermission and the specified permission.
IsSubsetOf(IPermission)

Determines whether the current XamlLoadPermission is a subset of the specified permission.
IsUnrestricted()

Returns whether this XamlLoadPermission denotes unrestricted permissions.
ToXml()

Creates an XML encoding of this XamlLoadPermission and its current state.
Union(IPermission)

Creates a permission that is the union of the current XamlLoadPermission and the specified permission.

Constructors

  • XamlLoadPermission(IEnumerable<XamlAccessLevel>)

    Initializes a new instance of the XamlLoadPermission class, using an enumerable set of specific XamlAccessLevel values.

    public XamlLoadPermission (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlAccessLevel> allowedAccess);

    Parameters

    • allowedAccess
      IEnumerable<XamlAccessLevel>

      An enumerable set of specific XamlAccessLevel values.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      allowedAccess is null.

    • ArgumentException

      allowedAccess contained invalid information, such as a null item.

    Remarks

    A call to this constructor initializes the AllowedAccess collection with each allowedAccess entry as an item, and sets the return for IsUnrestricted to false in the created instance.

  • XamlLoadPermission(PermissionState)

    Initializes a new instance of the XamlLoadPermission class, using existing permissions.

    public XamlLoadPermission (System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState state);

    Parameters

    • state
      PermissionState

      A PermissionState enumeration value.

    Remarks

    PermissionState sets the return for IsUnrestricted to true in the created instance. Any call to this constructor sets the AllowedAccess collection to null because it is not relevant if permissions are being reported rather than XamlAccessLevel.

  • XamlLoadPermission(XamlAccessLevel)

    Initializes a new instance of the XamlLoadPermission class, using a single XamlAccessLevel value.

    public XamlLoadPermission (System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlAccessLevel allowedAccess);

    Parameters

    • allowedAccess
      XamlAccessLevel

      The defining XamlAccessLevel value.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      allowedAccess is null.

    Remarks

    A call to this constructor initializes the AllowedAccess collection with allowedAccess as the only item, and sets the return for IsUnrestricted to false in the created instance.

Properties

  • AllowedAccess

    Gets the list of all XamlAccessLevel values that this XamlLoadPermission represents.

    public System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlAccessLevel> AllowedAccess { get; }

    Property Value

    • IList<XamlAccessLevel>

      A read-only list of XamlAccessLevel values, or null. See Remarks.

    Remarks

    If the current XamlLoadPermission is initialized such that IsUnrestricted is true, AllowedAccess may be null.

Methods

  • Copy()

    Creates and returns an identical copy of the current XamlLoadPermission.

    public override System.Security.IPermission Copy ();

    Returns

    • IPermission

      A copy of the current XamlLoadPermission.

    Remarks

    Per the interface contract of IPermission this value is IPermission in the signature but can be cast to XamlLoadPermission.

  • FromXml(SecurityElement)

    Reconstructs a security object with a specified state from an XML encoding.

    public override void FromXml (System.Security.SecurityElement elem);

    Parameters

    • elem
      SecurityElement

      The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      elem is null.

    • ArgumentException

      elem does not contain the XML encoding for a XamlLoadPermission.

      -or-

      The version attribute within elem is not supported.

  • Includes(XamlAccessLevel)

    Returns whether this XamlLoadPermission includes a specified XamlAccessLevel in its stem.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.AllowedAccess* list.

    public bool Includes (System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlAccessLevel requestedAccess);

    Parameters

    • requestedAccess
      XamlAccessLevel

      The specific XamlAccessLevel to check for.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if requestedAccess exists as an item in the stem.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.AllowedAccess* list of the current XamlLoadPermission. Otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      requestedAccess is null.

  • Intersect(IPermission)

    Creates and returns a XamlLoadPermission that is the intersection of the current XamlLoadPermission and the specified permission.

    public override System.Security.IPermission Intersect (System.Security.IPermission target);

    Parameters

    • target
      IPermission

      A XamlLoadPermission to intersect with the current XamlLoadPermission. Can be null.

    Returns

    • IPermission

      A new permission that represents the intersection of the current XamlLoadPermission and the specified XamlLoadPermission. This new permission is null if the intersection is empty.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      target is not null or is not a XamlLoadPermission.

    Remarks

    For union, intersect, and subset logic, IsUnrestricted is checked first, and might return a result based solely on that check. Next, AllowedAccess is checked.

  • IsSubsetOf(IPermission)

    Determines whether the current XamlLoadPermission is a subset of the specified permission.

    public override bool IsSubsetOf (System.Security.IPermission target);

    Parameters

    • target
      IPermission

      A permission that is to be tested for the subset relationship. Can be null.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the current XamlLoadPermission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      target is not null or is not a XamlLoadPermission.

    Remarks

    For union, intersect, and subset logic, IsUnrestricted is checked first, and might return a result based solely on that check. Next, AllowedAccess is checked.

    If target is null and the current XamlLoadPermission is both IsUnrestricted false and has an empty AllowedAccess list, this method returns true.

  • IsUnrestricted()

    Returns whether this XamlLoadPermission denotes unrestricted permissions.

    public bool IsUnrestricted ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if this XamlLoadPermission denotes unrestricted permissions. false if this XamlLoadPermission has specific access level restrictions in stem.Xaml.Permissions.XamlLoadPermission.AllowedAccess*, or has no permissions.

  • ToXml()

    Creates an XML encoding of this XamlLoadPermission and its current state.

    public override System.Security.SecurityElement ToXml ();

    Returns

    • SecurityElement

      An XML encoding of this XamlLoadPermission, including any state information.

  • Union(IPermission)

    Creates a permission that is the union of the current XamlLoadPermission and the specified permission.

    public override System.Security.IPermission Union (System.Security.IPermission other);

    Parameters

    • other
      IPermission

      A XamlLoadPermission to combine with the current XamlLoadPermission. Can be null.

    Returns

    • IPermission

      A new XamlLoadPermission that represents the union of the current XamlLoadPermission and the specified XamlLoadPermission.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      other is not null or is not a XamlLoadPermission.

    Remarks

    For union, intersect, and subset logic, IsUnrestricted is checked first, and might return a result based solely on that check. Next, AllowedAccess is checked.

    If other is null, the current XamlLoadPermission is returned.
